commit_message:
trove-guest to trove-guestagent

Use a heat trove template, template called trove-guest this service, but
the service does not exist, its name should be trove-guestagent.

Fixed bug #1321644

commit_message:
Change the default token logged length to 16

Based on comments from deployers at the Juno OpenStack summit,
limiting the default logged token length (to, by default, prevent
tokens from being fully logged) is a good idea.

Change-Id: I58980e85329d99de41f1c08f75e85973452317b1

commit_message:
Fix stack_resource's handle_adopt

- This changes a call from (non-existing) _to_parameters()
  to child_params() like the other surrounding calls to
  create_with_template()
- Also add a missing check_adopt_complete to stack_resource

Change-Id: I4ab9c299bf41d057f85b59dfdffa985e07a15bac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/30/91730/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix AvailabilityZone check for hosts in multiple aggregates

Check for multiple AZ was distinct when adding an host to an aggregate
and when updating an aggregate (or its metadata), which was leading to
possible corner-cases where logics were different.

This patch proposes a single way for checking for both API methods and
also adds an extra control on the possibility to have an aggregate with
its metadata AZ set to the configuration default value (eg. 'nova') and
where it was possible to subsequently have one host in two disctinct AZs
Fixed that scenerio as it is a gap, Nova as of now preventing to have
one host in two distinct AZs.

Change-Id: Ida6aa507f34f36a436adaafe1f7609963c59a9bc
Partial-Bug: #1277230

Change-Id: I52b8bb6c31fbb3b699ad8056ce187e325cf31bcb

commit_message:
Proposal to enable running master against havana

This proposal is a sub-proposal of the branchless-tempest blueprint.

Proposes bp:master-against-havana

Change-Id: I52b8bb6c31fbb3b699ad8056ce187e325cf31bcb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qa-specs refs/changes/28/87028/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ============================= The title of your blueprint ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/master-against-havana Problem description =================== There is a proposal to stop branching tempest an ensure that master can run against supported stable branches: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/branchless-tempest That proposal imposes additional restrictions on how tempest tests can be changed or added. A significant number of changes were made to tempest between havana and icehouse that would not have been allowed under that proposal. It is still desirable to run master against havana (refstack, as one example) but there are now api differences between havana and master so some changes need to be made in order to run master against havana. We have non-voting gate jobs running master-against-havana on the tempest and devstack projects. Here is an example run (with nova v3 disabled but no other changes): https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86416/ Proposed change =============== Making the master-agaist-havana jobs run without errors requires several sorts of changes: 1. Some changes need to be made to devstack stable/havana so that it can configure the master tempest.conf to work against havana. This includes disabling of nova v3 since many incompatible changes were made and v3 is not supported in havana. Some other classes of tests can also be disabled, particularly for neutron. 2. A lot of changes were made to apis in the icehouse release that were not detected due to lack of stringent application of the api stability guidelines by tempest. In particular, extra values were added to return dictionaries. There is currently activity to add more stringency to the tempest tests. In addition, new tests were added that fail against havana possibly due to bugs in havana. Because there is no rhyme or reason to these kinds of changes they cannot be disabled by turning off some feature-enabled flag. We would have to add a flag to tempest that says whether you are running against havana and just skip the failing tests. If a new test fails against havana we would decide whether to skip it for havana or backport a fix. The issues about what to do about deployments doing CD are the same as with the main branchless tempest proposal. Alternatives ------------ The alternative is to ignore havana. Since refstack is going to support havana, and many people will want to do this for other havana testing, it is going to happen anyway somewhere. We might as well do this together. This is similar to the rationale behind why we created stable branches in the first place for all projects. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <None> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-1 Work Items ---------- 1. Eliminate as many failures as possible by changing stable/havana devstack to place the tests behind an enabled feature. 2. Introduce a conf flag for havana-skip. 3. Analyze each remaining failure in the current master-against-havana runs and do one of: a) Skip it b) Backport a fix to stable/havana project branch c) Remove the test The same consideration will apply whenever a tempest patch breaks this job. 4. Enable the master-against-havana job as gating all projects Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Synced jsonutils from oslo-incubator

The sync includes change that drastically enhances performance on Python
2.6 with fresh simplejson library installed.

The latest commit in oslo-incubator:
- 732bdb6297eb9de81667f7713ebcb1ccc2ee45a7

Change-Id: Ib3dc0b713ed90396919feba018772243b3b9c90f
Closes-Bug: 1314129

commit_message:
Neutron Allowed Address Pair API test

Adds a script to test the Neutron API extension for Allowed Address Pair.

Also adds to the xml ReST clent for Neutron the plurals definition for allowed
address pairs

Change-Id: I1dd1e299f4436f5a613351f612cb078e630c7026
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/59/66259/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # Copyright 2013 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.network import base from tempest import exceptions from tempest import test class AllowedAddressPairJSON(base.BaseNetworkTest): _interface = 'json' """ Tests the Neutron Allowed Address Pair API extension using the Tempest ReST client. The following API operations are tested with this extension: create port list ports update port show port v2.0 of the Neutron API is assumed. It is also assumed that the following options are defined in the [network-feature-enabled] section of etc/tempest.conf api_extensions """ @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(AllowedAddressPairJSON, cls).setUpClass() if not test.is_extension_enabled('allowed-address-pairs', 'network'): msg = "Allowed Address Pairs extension not enabled." raise cls.skipException(msg) cls.network = cls.create_network() cls.name = cls.network['name'] cls.subnet = cls.create_subnet(cls.network) cls.port = cls.create_port(cls.network) cls.ip_address = cls.port["fixed_ips"][0]["ip_address"] cls.mac_address = cls.port["mac_address"] @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_list_port_with_address_pair(self): allowed_address_pairs = [{"ip_address": self.ip_address, "mac_address": self.mac_address}] resp, body = self.client.create_port( self.network['id'], allowed_address_pairs=allowed_address_pairs) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) self.ports.append(body['port']) port_id = body['port']['id'] resp, body = self.client.list_ports() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) ports = body['ports'] for p in ports: if p['id'] == port_id: ip_address = p['allowed_address_pairs'][0]['ip_address'] mac_address = p['allowed_address_pairs'][0]['mac_address'] self.assertEqual(ip_address, self.ip_address) self.assertEqual(mac_address, self.mac_address) break else: raise exceptions.NotFound('Port not found') def test_update_show_port_with_address_pair(self): pass class AllowedAddressPairXML(AllowedAddressPairJSON): _interface = 'xml'

added_lines: from oslo.config import cfgopts = [ cfg.StrOpt('stack-user-domain-name', default="heat", help="Name of domain to create for stack users."), cfg.StrOpt('stack-domain-admin', default="heat_stack_admin", help="Keystone username with roles sufficient to manage users" " and projects in the stack-user-domain"), cfg.StrOpt('stack-domain-admin-password', help="Password to set for stack-domain-admin"), ] for opt in opts: cfg.CONF.register_opt(opt, cli=True) cfg.CONF(sys.argv[1:], project='heat', prog='heat-keystone-setup-domain') HEAT_DOMAIN_NAME = os.environ.get( 'HEAT_DOMAIN', cfg.CONF.stack_user_domain_name) HEAT_DOMAIN_ADMIN = os.environ.get('HEAT_DOMAIN_ADMIN', cfg.CONF.stack_domain_admin) HEAT_DOMAIN_PASSWORD = os.environ.get('HEAT_DOMAIN_PASSWORD', cfg.CONF.stack_domain_admin_password) logger.error("Must export HEAT_DOMAIN_PASSWORD or use" " --stack-domain-admin-password")
deleted_lines: HEAT_DOMAIN_NAME = os.environ.get('HEAT_DOMAIN', 'heat') HEAT_DOMAIN_ADMIN = os.environ.get('HEAT_DOMAIN_ADMIN', 'heat_domain_admin') HEAT_DOMAIN_PASSWORD = os.environ.get('HEAT_DOMAIN_PASSWORD', None) logger.error("Must export HEAT_DOMAIN_PASSWORD for domain admin user")

commit_message:
Changed Trove CLI list headers to match Nova CLI

Added ability to pass in header labels to print_list.
If not passed in, header lables are automatically created
from the fields by replacing '_' with spaces and capitalizing
each word.  IDs are also capitalized.  All field data is
now left-aligned, except numerics which are right-aligned.

Also changed print_dict so that all values are left-aligned.

Change-Id: I3b69dc7f92c496594cf37832f4ff98f1abdf52dd
Closes-Bug: #1272700

commit_message:
Fix empty resource list index out of range error

The patch append resource_name into the fields when the resources are
empty. So to avoid the index out of range error.

Change-Id: I068d1ea199c7506aacaf4692479f9070107db724
Closes-Bug: #1307269

commit_message:
hacking:assertIsNone should be used when using None with assertEqual

O102 hacking rule:assertEqual(A, None) or assertEqual(None, A)sentences
are not allowed. This patch alse fixes the violation.

Implements blueprint: oslo-local-hacking

Change-Id: Iac39aba98a67e1f9b6853bbcc53ee6861e124005
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/09/92309/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: assert_equal_end_with_none_re = re.compile( r"(.)*assertEqual\((\w|\.|\'|\"|\[|\])+, None\)") assert_equal_start_with_none_re = re.compile( r"(.)*assertEqual\(None, (\w|\.|\'|\"|\[|\])+\)")def assert_equal_none(logical_line): """Check for assertEqual(A, None) or assertEqual(None, A) sentences O102: assertEqual(A, None) or assertEqual(None, A)sentences not allowed. """ res = (assert_equal_start_with_none_re.match(logical_line) or assert_equal_end_with_none_re.match(logical_line)) if res: yield (0, "N102: assertEqual(A, None) or assertEqual(None, A) " "sentences not allowed") register(assert_equal_none)

added_lines: cls.job_binary_data = 'Some script may be data' name, cls.job_binary_data)[1] def _create_internal_job_binary(self, binary_name=None): """Creates Internal Job Binary with optional name specified. It puts data into Sahara database and ensures response status and binary name. Returns id and name of created binary. """ if not binary_name: # generate random name if it's not specified binary_name = data_utils.rand_name('sahara-internal-job-binary') # create internal job binary resp, body = self.create_internal_job_binary(binary_name, self.job_binary_data) # ensure that binary created successfully self._check_resp_status_code_and_name(202, binary_name, resp.status, body['name']) return body['id'], binary_name @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_internal_job_binary_create(self): self._create_internal_job_binary() @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_internal_job_binary_list(self): binary_info = self._create_internal_job_binary() # check for data source in list resp, binaries = self.client.list_internal_job_binaries() self._check_job_binary_in_list(resp, binaries, binary_info) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_internal_job_binary_get(self): binary_id, binary_name = self._create_internal_job_binary() # check data source fetch by id resp, binary = self.client.get_internal_job_binary(binary_id) self._check_resp_status_code_and_name(200, binary_name, resp.status, binary['name']) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_internal_job_binary_delete(self): binary_id = self._create_internal_job_binary()[0] # delete the internal job binary by id resp = self.client.delete_internal_job_binary(binary_id)[0] self.assertEqual(204, resp.status) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_job_binary_get_data(self): job_binary_id = self._create_job_binary(self.internal_db_job_binary)[0] # check job binary data fetch by job binary id data = self.client.get_job_binary_data(job_binary_id) self.assertEqual(self.job_binary_data, data)

commit_message:
Sahara: add API tests for job binaries

* create/list/get/delete API tests for job binaries in Swift
  and in Sahara database were added

Partially implements: blueprint savanna-api-tests

Change-Id: Iac29f7edb0aa78492eb16c556a048daf33212975
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/44/94344/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Mirantis Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.api.data_processing import base as dp_base from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest import config from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF class JobBinaryTest(dp_base.BaseDataProcessingTest): @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(JobBinaryTest, cls).setUpClass() cls.job_binary_with_extra = { 'url': 'swift://sahara-container/example.jar', 'description': 'Test job binary', 'extra': { 'user': CONF.identity.username, 'password': CONF.identity.password } } cls.job_binary = cls.job_binary_with_extra.copy() del cls.job_binary['extra'] def _create_job_binary(self, binary_name=None): """Creates Job Binary with optional name specified. It creates a link to example.jar file (it may not exist) and ensures response status and binary name. Returns id and name of created binary. """ if not binary_name: # generate random name if it's not specified binary_name = data_utils.rand_name('sahara-job-binary') # create job binary resp, body = self.create_job_binary(binary_name, **self.job_binary_with_extra) # ensure that binary created successfully self.assertEqual(202, resp.status) self.assertEqual(binary_name, body['name']) self.assertDictContainsSubset(self.job_binary, body) return body['id'], binary_name def _list_job_binaries(self, binary_info): # check for job binary in list resp, binaries = self.client.list_job_binaries() self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) binaries_info = [(binary['id'], binary['name']) for binary in binaries] self.assertIn(binary_info, binaries_info) def _get_job_binary(self, binary_id, binary_name): # check job binary fetch by id resp, binary = self.client.get_job_binary(binary_id) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) self.assertEqual(binary_name, binary['name']) self.assertDictContainsSubset(self.job_binary, binary) def _delete_job_binary(self, binary_id): # delete the job binary by id resp = self.client.delete_job_binary(binary_id)[0] self.assertEqual(204, resp.status) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_job_binary_create(self): self._create_job_binary() @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_job_binary_list(self): binary_info = self._create_job_binary() self._list_job_binaries(binary_info) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_job_binary_get(self): binary_id, binary_name = self._create_job_binary() self._get_job_binary(binary_id, binary_name) @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_job_binary_delete(self): binary_id = self._create_job_binary()[0] self._delete_job_binary(binary_id)

commit_message:
Use venv to build documentation

The Sphinx documentation can be made to use the `program-output` plugin
which would invoke commands to generate inline documentation.

The resulting output should correspond to bash8 source, not the
currently installed version on the host running the doc.

That also let us ensure the requirements are properly defined.

Change-Id: Ie09707f35df1a5aa06995e31ba3160dcfb386b37

commit_message:
Make the new xprofile tests optional.

On Lucid at least, xprofile doesn't work. While others try to figure out the
underlying issue, this patch would just skip the tests if the profiling code
can not be imported.

Change-Id: I0fee3f729742cc727edc2adabb4ed782bea7798f

commit_message:
Add pattern checks for v3 extension

On v3 extension API, name should be camelcase and alias should contain
lowcase chars and '-'. This patch adds string pattern checks for them.

Related-Bug: #1315597
Change-Id: I0524a8145b62d7ab1c9591fcc8ba005154245c08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/10/92010/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'name': { 'type': 'string', # NOTE: name should be camelcase. 'pattern': '[A-Z]{1}[a-z]{1}[a-zA-Z]' }, 'alias': { 'type': 'string', # NOTE: alias should contain lowcase chars # and '-' only . 'pattern': '[a-z-]+' },

commit_message:
Make hacking test more accurate

Hacking check returns tuple or None, assertTrue/assertFalse doesn't
handle the return results properly. For example, non-tuple return value
also can pass the hacking unit test method.

  * use assertEqual or assertIsInstance instead of assertTrue
  * use assertIsNone instead of assertFalse
  * remove duplicated test data in method test_virt_driver_imports

Change-Id: Iee8b466c3ab2c6437144367cdb874bd2f8839984

added_lines: check_entries = [ ("from nova.virt.libvirt import utils as libvirt_utils", "./nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py"), ("from nova.virt.libvirt import utils as libvirt_utils", "./nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py"), ("import nova.virt.libvirt.utils as libvirt_utils", "./nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py"), ("import nova.virt.firewall", "./nova/virt/libvirt/firewall.py"), ] expect = (0, "N311: importing code from other virt drivers forbidden") for physical_line, filename in check_entries: result = checks.import_no_virt_driver_import_deps(physical_line, filename) self.assertTupleEqual(expect, result) self.assertIsInstance(checks.import_no_virt_driver_config_deps( "./nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py"), tuple) self.assertIsInstance(checks.no_author_tags("# author: jogo"), tuple) self.assertIsInstance(checks.no_author_tags("# @author: jogo"), tuple) self.assertIsInstance(checks.no_author_tags("# @Author: jogo"), tuple) self.assertIsInstance(checks.no_author_tags("# Author: jogo"), tuple) self.assertIsInstance(checks.no_author_tags(".. moduleauthor:: jogo"), tuple) self.assertIsNone(checks.no_author_tags("# authorization of this"))
deleted_lines: self.assertTrue(checks.import_no_virt_driver_import_deps( "from nova.virt.libvirt import utils as libvirt_utils", "./nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py")) self.assertIsNone(checks.import_no_virt_driver_import_deps( "from nova.virt.libvirt import utils as libvirt_utils", "./nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py")) self.assertTrue(checks.import_no_virt_driver_import_deps( "import nova.virt.libvirt.utils as libvirt_utils", "./nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py")) self.assertTrue(checks.import_no_virt_driver_import_deps( "import nova.virt.libvirt.utils as libvirt_utils", "./nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py")) self.assertIsNone(checks.import_no_virt_driver_import_deps( "import nova.virt.firewall", "./nova/virt/libvirt/firewall.py")) self.assertTrue(checks.import_no_virt_driver_config_deps( "./nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py")) self.assertTrue(checks.no_author_tags("# author: jogo")) self.assertTrue(checks.no_author_tags("# @author: jogo")) self.assertTrue(checks.no_author_tags("# @Author: jogo")) self.assertTrue(checks.no_author_tags("# Author: jogo")) self.assertTrue(checks.no_author_tags(".. moduleauthor:: jogo")) self.assertFalse(checks.no_author_tags("# authorization of this"))

commit_message:
Added check for empty attributes in trove CLI

Validated that new attributes are passed in for
user-update-attributes.  Added unit test and changed help message.

Change-Id: I1363278912fb5ffddd2e64550dc6ba70df8a9df8
Closes-Bug: #1298760

commit_message:
Improve help strings

Follow oslo.config style guide for help strings better to create
more consistent help strings:
* Capitalize first word of each help string
* Finish help strings with "."
* Improve wording, capitalization

Change-Id: I8a8832c02f0af955a58080371459ff6edffcb111

commit_message:
Imported Translations from Transifex

Change-Id: I8509a564f8db79c2796fef72aaa7f8615cbe20c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/37/94537/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2014-05-21 06:17+0000\n"msgid "The operating system that is installed on your laptop or desktop that hosts virtual machines. This is commonly referred to as the host OS or <glossterm>host</glossterm>. In short, the machine where your Virtual Box is installed."msgid "The operating system that is installed on your Virtual Box Virtual Machine. This virtual instance is independent of the host OS. It is commonly referred to as <glossterm>guest OS</glossterm> or guest."msgid "Hosts the database, Keystone (Middleware), and the servers for the scope of the current OpenStack deployment. It acts as the brains behind OpenStack and drives services such as authentication, database, and so on."msgid "After the network interfaces file has been setup, you can switch to an SSH session by using an OpenSSH client to log in remotely to the required server node (Control, Network, Compute). Open a terminal on your host machine and run the following command: <placeholder-1/>"msgid "Security groups and security group rules allow administrators and tenants the ability to specify the type of traffic and direction (ingress/egress) that is allowed to pass through a port. A security group is a container for security group rules."msgid "When a port is created in OpenStack Networking it is associated with a security group. If a security group is not specified the port will be associated with a 'default' security group. By default this group will drop all ingress traffic and allow all egress traffic. Rules can be added to this group in order to change this behaviour."msgid "If one desires to use the OpenStack Compute security group APIs and/or have OpenStack Compute orchestrate the creation of new ports for instances on specific security groups, additional configuration is needed. To enable this, one must configure the following file /etc/nova/nova.conf and set the config option security_group_api=neutron on every node running nova-compute and nova-api. After this change is made, restart nova-api and nova-compute in order to pick up this change. After this change is made, the user will be able to use both the OpenStack Compute and OpenStack Network security group API at the same time."msgid "OpenStack Networking uses the OpenStack Identity service (project name keystone) as the default authentication service. When OpenStack Identity is enabled, users submitting requests to the OpenStack Networking service must provide an authentication token in X-Auth-Token request header. The aforementioned token should have been obtained by authenticating with the OpenStack Identity endpoint. For more information concerning authentication with OpenStack Identity, please refer to the OpenStack Identity documentation. When OpenStack Identity is enabled, it is not mandatory to specify tenant_id for resources in create requests, as the tenant identifier will be derived from the Authentication token. Please note that the default authorization settings only allow administrative users to create resources on behalf of a different tenant. OpenStack Networking uses information received from OpenStack Identity to authorize user requests. OpenStack Networking handles two kind of authorization policies:"msgid "<emphasis role=\"bold\">Operation-based:</emphasis> policies specify access criteria for specific operations, possibly with fine-grained control over specific attributes."
deleted_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2014-05-16 06:35+0000\n"msgid "The operating system that is installed on your laptop or desktop that hosts virtual machines. Commonly referred to as host OS or <glossterm>host</glossterm>. In short, the machine where your Virtual Box is installed."msgid "The operating system that is installed on your Virtual Box Virtual Machine. This virtual instance is independent of the host OS. Commonly referred to as <glossterm>guest OS</glossterm> or guest."msgid "Hosts the database, Keystone (Middleware), and the servers for the scope of the current OpenStack deployment. Acts as the brains behind OpenStack and drives services such as authentication, database, and so on."msgid "After you set up the network interfaces file, you can switch to an SSH session by using an OpenSSH client to log in remotely to the required server node (Control, Network, Compute). Open a terminal on your host machine. Run the following command: <placeholder-1/>"msgid "Security groups and security group rules allows administrators and tenants the ability to specify the type of traffic and direction (ingress/egress) that is allowed to pass through a port. A security group is a container for security group rules."msgid "When a port is created in OpenStack Networking it is associated with a security group. If a security group is not specified the port will be associated with a 'default' security group. By default this group will drop all ingress traffic and allow all egress. Rules can be added to this group in order to change the behaviour."msgid "If one desires to use the OpenStack Compute security group APIs and/or have OpenStack Compute orchestrate the creation of new ports for instances on specific security groups, additional configuration is needed. To enable this, one must configure the following file /etc/nova/nova.conf and set the config option security_group_api=neutron on every node running nova-compute and nova-api. After this change is made restart nova-api and nova-compute in order to pick up this change. After this change is made one will be able to use both the OpenStack Compute and OpenStack Network security group API at the same time."msgid "OpenStack Networking uses the OpenStack Identity service (project name keystone) as the default authentication service. When OpenStack Identity is enabled Users submitting requests to the OpenStack Networking service must provide an authentication token in X-Auth-Token request header. The aforementioned token should have been obtained by authenticating with the OpenStack Identity endpoint. For more information concerning authentication with OpenStack Identity, please refer to the OpenStack Identity documentation. When OpenStack Identity is enabled, it is not mandatory to specify tenant_id for resources in create requests, as the tenant identifier will be derived from the Authentication token. Please note that the default authorization settings only allow administrative users to create resources on behalf of a different tenant. OpenStack Networking uses information received from OpenStack Identity to authorize user requests. OpenStack Networking handles two kind of authorization policies:"msgid "<emphasis role=\"bold\">Operation-based:</emphasis> policies specify access criteria for specific operations, possibly with fine-grained control over specific attributes;"

commit_message:
Added gettext to install_prep_packages

To verify the validity of po/pot files, there is now a dependency
on the msgfmt utility found in the gettext package.
(This was introduced by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/84239 )

The gettext package has therefore been added to the redstack
install_prep_packages function.

Change-Id: Iba6688dc3ef77ce6669253115d70a908f089ccd6
Closes-Bug: #1317652
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/17/92917/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pkg_install git-core kvm-ipxe python-pip gettext

Change-Id: Ie7e8f4ed649a750431b843469804bcc359324df1

commit_message:
Add delete node to nova-manage

Add ability to permanently delete a retired compute node. The idea is
to make simple database queries, no schema changes, though that may
be necessary when this is to be implemented.

blueprint add-delete-node-to-nova-manage

Change-Id: Ie7e8f4ed649a750431b843469804bcc359324df1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/36/94536/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Add 'delete-node' to nova-manage ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-delete-node-to-nova-manage Currently there is no way to delete a compute node from an existing environment - the compute node can be marked as deleted, but this doesn't delete anything. For the sake of sanity with regards to database content and also for the ease of use aspect, it would be nice to have the ability to not only delete a compute node from an environment, but actually have it deleted, not just marked as such. Problem description =================== There is currently no way to manually delete a compute node aside from making manual database changes. For an end-user, this makes it impossible to delete old decommissioned nodes. For an operator, it makes it a hassle to deal with, since it is easier to just type a command and have the CLI make the API call, which in turn will make the necessary database changes for you. Proposed change =============== Add an API call that will allow for actual compute node deletion from a database - in all applicable tables. Add CLI funtionality to make this API call and verify success. (This will likely just be needed for python-novaclient, but adding here for completeness.) Alternatives ------------ I have seen no other alternatives to deleting an old node aside from making database changes. The goal here is to make that manual labor obsolete and to also allow for the permanent deletion where desired. Data model impact ----------------- There should be no changes needed, since the proposition is simply allowing for making database queries, not schema changes. REST API impact --------------- * delete-node * Permanently delete retired compute node. * POST or DELETE - not sure which is more ideal here. * /delete-node/ * Pass UUID of hypervisor Security impact --------------- This should not require anything other than 'nova' database user access, since my proposed change only affects hypervisor information. This proposed change should also be only accessible via 'nova-manage', versus simply 'nova' so that it can only be run an admin. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- There should be a python-novaclient call created for my proposed API addition. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: None Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Create API call * Create call function in python-novaclient Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= A simple test to create a new hypervisor in the database, and then delete that hypervisor should be sufficient. Documentation Impact ==================== There will need to be a change to the related nova pages in the documentation. I can [and would] personally take care of the doc changes. References ========== None.

subject: Set the volume access mode during volume attach
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-22 19:42:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/test_block_device.py', 'nova/volume/cinder.py', 'nova/tests/fake_volume.py', 'nova/tests/volume/test_cinder.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/de05c2994212e83eba3cedf2544cdc549d9f8184', 'message': "Set the volume access mode during volume attach

cinderclient supports an optional keyword argument named 'mode'
for volumes.attach(), which allows you to set the access mode of
a volume at attach time. The keyword argument is not passed in
by nova when it attaches a read-only volume, making the volume
access mode default to 'rw' instead of the desired 'ro'. This
patch finds the access mode of the volume and passes it to
cinderclient, so the correct access mode is used at attach
time.

Change-Id: Ib62f454292e60114f96debbad96c4a356dc32a21
Closes-Bug: #1307088
"}]
commit_message:
Set the volume access mode during volume attach

cinderclient supports an optional keyword argument named 'mode'
for volumes.attach(), which allows you to set the access mode of
a volume at attach time. The keyword argument is not passed in
by nova when it attaches a read-only volume, making the volume
access mode default to 'rw' instead of the desired 'ro'. This
patch finds the access mode of the volume and passes it to
cinderclient, so the correct access mode is used at attach
time.

Change-Id: Ib62f454292e60114f96debbad96c4a356dc32a21
Closes-Bug: #1307088
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/84/89684/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mode = 'rw' if 'data' in connection_info: mode = connection_info['data'].get('access_mode', 'rw') volume_api.attach(context, volume_id, instance['uuid'], self['mount_device'], mode=mode)

commit_message:
Fix call to mock.assert_not_called()

There is no assert_not_called() method in mock, as described here:
https://code.google.com/p/mock/issues/detail?id=159
Fix the call to use the mock.called attribute instead.

Change-Id: I4b37764ac65736934fe3448bc50520bcd84ff61d

Change-Id: Id931ffdb1013dc9368aaae580cd6270b4492c339

commit_message:
Support syslogs on Fedora

Use a timestamp and journalctl on Fedora to get the clean syslog logs
from the start of the run

Change-Id: Id931ffdb1013dc9368aaae580cd6270b4492c339
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/48/93248/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Start with a fresh syslog if is_ubuntu; then sudo stop rsyslog sudo mv /var/log/syslog /var/log/syslog-pre-devstack sudo mv /var/log/kern.log /var/log/kern_log-pre-devstack sudo touch /var/log/syslog sudo chown /var/log/syslog --ref /var/log/syslog-pre-devstack sudo chmod /var/log/syslog --ref /var/log/syslog-pre-devstack sudo chmod a+r /var/log/syslog sudo touch /var/log/kern.log sudo chown /var/log/kern.log --ref /var/log/kern_log-pre-devstack sudo chmod /var/log/kern.log --ref /var/log/kern_log-pre-devstack sudo chmod a+r /var/log/kern.log sudo start rsyslog elif is_fedora; then # save timestamp and use journalctl to dump everything since # then at the end date +"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S" > $BASE/log-start-timestamp.txt fi # No matter what, archive logs and config files if is_ubuntu; then sudo cp /var/log/syslog $BASE/logs/syslog.txt sudo cp /var/log/kern.log $BASE/logs/kern_log.txt elif is_fedora; then # the journal gives us syslog() and kernel output, so is like # a concatenation of the above. sudo journalctl --since="$(cat $BASE/log-start-timestamp.txt)" \ > $BASE/logs/syslog.txt fi
deleted_lines: # Start with a fresh syslog sudo stop rsyslog sudo mv /var/log/syslog /var/log/syslog-pre-devstack sudo mv /var/log/kern.log /var/log/kern_log-pre-devstack sudo touch /var/log/syslog sudo chown /var/log/syslog --ref /var/log/syslog-pre-devstack sudo chmod /var/log/syslog --ref /var/log/syslog-pre-devstack sudo chmod a+r /var/log/syslog sudo touch /var/log/kern.log sudo chown /var/log/kern.log --ref /var/log/kern_log-pre-devstack sudo chmod /var/log/kern.log --ref /var/log/kern_log-pre-devstack sudo chmod a+r /var/log/kern.log sudo start rsyslog # No matter what, archive logs and config files sudo cp /var/log/syslog $BASE/logs/syslog.txt sudo cp /var/log/kern.log $BASE/logs/kern_log.txt

commit_message:
debug level logs should not be translated

According to the OpenStack translation policy available at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards debug messages
should not be translated. Like mentioned in several changes in
Nova by garyk this is to help prioritize log translation.

Change-Id: I4af4a45a56b1364a2f5196b75cff299d607ab393
Partial-Bug: #1317950

commit_message:
not display loading image for rescued instances

If, any of the instances are rescued or shelved through CLI
those instances status are displayed as rescue or shelved offloaded
with a loading image.

Displaying the loading image for this two status are not correct.

Displaying the loading image is removed for
the rescue and shelved offloaded status.

Change-Id: Ic29da8bc4a6bc75ae9269280f5b28e9ad6a63c2e
Closes-Bug: #1318558
Co-Authored-By: Mizielski Robert <robert.mizielski@cloudwatt.com>

commit_message:
Adds roadmap for Install Guides

Change-Id: I0bb205bbdb425a195ae54ae93fb4c374988c8a50
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/90/94390/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Roadmap for Install Guides -------------------------- This file is stored with the source to offer ideas for what to work on. Put your name next to a task if you want to work on it and put a WIP review up on review.openstack.org. May 20, 2014 This guide has an overall blueprint with spec at: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/InstallationGuideImprovements To do tasks: - Remove openstack-config (crudini) commands; standardize manual install - Unify chapter and section names (such as Overview) - Add sample output of each command and highlight important parts - Mention project as standard but tenant must be used for CLI params - Refer to generic SQL database and update for MariaDB (RHEL), MySQL, and PostgreSQL - Provide sample configuration files for each node - Compute and network nodes should reference server on controller node - Update password list - Add audience information; who is this book intended for Ongoing tasks: - Ensure it meets conventions and standards - Continually update with latest release information relevant to install Wishlist tasks: - Replace all individual client commands (like keystone, nova) with openstack client commands

commit_message:
Disallow changing quota to lower than current usage

Attempting to update resource quotas to a value lower than what is already
in use should fail.

Change-Id: I771f3c67488862443e669d7b42edb5f97da1339c
Closes-bug: #1304234

added_lines: from neutron.db import l3_dbfrom neutron.db import securitygroups_db from neutron.db.vpn import vpn_db DbQuotaDriver._check_resource_in_use(context, resource, limit) @staticmethod def _check_resource_in_use(context, resource, limit): quota_resources = { 'network': models_v2.Network, 'subnet': models_v2.Subnet, 'port': models_v2.Port, 'router': l3_db.Router, 'floatingip': l3_db.FloatingIP, 'security_group': securitygroups_db.SecurityGroup, 'security_group_rule': securitygroups_db.SecurityGroupRule, 'vpnservice': vpn_db.VPNService, 'ikepolicy': vpn_db.IKEPolicy, 'ipsec_site_connection': vpn_db.IPsecSiteConnection, 'ipsecpolicy': vpn_db.IPsecPolicy } in_used_resources = (context.session. query(quota_resources[resource]).all()) if len(in_used_resources) > limit: msg = (_("Quota value %(value)s for %(resource)s are " "less than already used " "%(used)s") % {'value': limit, 'resource': resource, 'used': len(in_used_resources)}) raise exceptions.InvalidInput(error_message=msg)

commit_message:
Sort requirement files in alphabetical order

This makes code more readable, and can check whether specific library
in the requirement files easily. We also enforce the check in pep8.

Change-Id: I1dbe71fa4c7da6756e678df9a36d4028fdbe7bb4
Closes-Bug: #1285478

commit_message:
Add documentation for DIB_* global image-build variables

Text written after reading the source and commit messages for
the various variables as they were added.

Change-Id: Ia4de21270dacd986d0de14dbbf73b08082a57015
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/52/92752/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The following environment variables can be used to modify the behaviour of the image build scripts: * DIB\_ADD\_APT\_KEYS : points to a folder of apt repository GPG keys. Each key will be verified and installed ith apt-key to the apt keyring. * DIB\_APT\_CONF : if set replace the default apt.conf file in the image. * DIB\_APT\_SOURCES : if set replace the default sources.list file in the image. * DIB\_CCACHE\_DIR : used to override the default location of the ccache cache. * DIB\_CLOUD\_IMAGES : can be used to override the URL for downloading base images for redhat or ubuntu. * DIB\_DEBIAN\_ALT\_INIT\_PACKAGE : if set override the system startup executable. * DIB\_DISTRIBUTION\_MIRROR : can be set to a cached copy of the ubuntu or debian archives. * DIB\_EXTLINUX : if set use the Extlinux bootloader instead of GRUB2. * DIB\_GITREPOBASE : setting this variable sets the base url for all git repositories used by the source-repositories element. * DIB\_IMAGE\_CACHE : can be overriden to specify a location for cached image files. * DIB\_INIT\_SYSTEM : specifies the default init system used, e.g upstart, systemd or sysv. * DIB\_INSTALLTYPE\_* : allows the install type for particular elements to be specified. For example, to enable the package install type for the set of nova elements that use `nova` as the install type prefix, define DIB_INSTALLTYPE_nova=package. * DIB\_KERNEL\_VERSION : can be set to override the kernel version used in the image. * DIB\_LIB\_UDEV\_ROOT : can be set to override the location of the udev root in the ramdisk image. * DIB\_LOCAL\_IMAGE : setting this variable allows a local copy of a cloud image to be used instead of downloading it from the vendor. * DIB\_MANIFEST\_IMAGE\_DIR : specifies the location of where the image manifest files are written. * DIB\_MANIFEST\_SAVE\_DIR : specifies where an additional copy of the manifest files are written. * DIB\_MIN\_TMPFS : specifies the minimum size of the tmpfs mount used to improve build type if enough memory is present on the host node. * DIB\_MODPROBE\_BLACKLIST : provides a custom list of modules which will be disabled via modprobe.d/blacklist.conf in the image. * DIB\_MODULE\_ROOT : can be overridden to specify a custom location for the kernel modules in an image. * DIB\_NO\_PYPI\_PIP : if set don't use pypi.python.org to install dependent python modules. * DIB\_NO\_TMPFS : if set do not create a tmpfs mount to build the image in. * DIB\_REG\_TYPE : set to "rhn" for Red Hat Network (RHN classic) registration. The image building process will register the system to RHN and apply the associated Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server subscription so the latest package updates can be applied. At the end of the image building process, the system will be unregistered from RHN. * DIB\_RELEASE : can be used to specify the ubuntu or debian release used in the image build process. * DIB\_REPOLOCATION\_* : can be used to change the registered location for an installation source. For example set DIB\_REPOLOCATION\_nova=https://review.openstack.org/openstack/nova and DIB\_REPOREF\_nova=refs/changes/72/61972/8 to build an image using code from a gerrit review. * DIB\_REPOREF\_* : can be used in combination with DIB\_REPOLOCATION\_* to specify a git reference for a source package. * DIB\_REPOTYPE\_* : can be used to specify the repository type for a source package. * DIB\_RHN\_CHANNELS : set to a space-separated list of RHN channels to add. For example DIB\_RHN\_CHANNELS="rhel-x86_64-server-6 rhel-x86_64-server-6-rhscl-1". RHN username/password is required for this. * DIB\_RHSM\_POOL : set to a subscription pool if you do not want the system to use the `--auto-attach` feature of `subscription-manager`. * DIB\_RHSM\_REPOS : set to a space-separated list of Red Hat repositories to enable. * DIB\_RHSM\_PASSWORD : set to the password used to register the system with RHSM during the image building process. * DIB\_RHSM\_USER : set to the username used to register the system with RHSM during the image building process. * DIB\_SAT\_CERT\_RPM\_URL : can be used to specify the RHN Satellite server URL. * DIB\_SAT\_KEY : can be set to use a RHN Satelite server activation key. * DIB\_SAT\_URL : can be set to specify a RHN Satellite server URL.

subject: Split large-ops into three tests so each has its own timeout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-09 20:41:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/f8729d10af6fea5ebcaba1682540bbb924a2b0b0', 'message': 'Split large-ops into three tests so each has its own timeout

In the gate OS_TEST_TIMEOUT is 500 seconds, which is a per test timeout.
large-ops is run one test three times, so split it out to three tests so
each has its own OS_TEST_TIMEOUT.

This works because the cleanup of resources is done in tearDownClass and tests inside a class are run serially (although order cannot be guaranteed).

Change-Id: Iefa6f0fec9b3eea587b1437b47cce81e1a9c242c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-09 20:43:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/0fec5342c89a7f364c4553f0e44b9fb835338293', 'message': 'Split large-ops into three tests so each has its own timeout

In the gate OS_TEST_TIMEOUT is 500 seconds, which is a per test timeout.
large-ops is run one test three times, so split it out to three tests so
each has its own OS_TEST_TIMEOUT.

This works because the cleanup of resources is done in tearDownClass and
tests inside a class are run serially (although order cannot be guaranteed).

Change-Id: Iefa6f0fec9b3eea587b1437b47cce81e1a9c242c

commit_message:
Split large-ops into three tests so each has its own timeout

In the gate OS_TEST_TIMEOUT is 500 seconds, which is a per test timeout.
large-ops is run one test three times, so split it out to three tests so
each has its own OS_TEST_TIMEOUT.

This works because the cleanup of resources is done in tearDownClass and
tests inside a class are run serially (although order cannot be guaranteed).

Note: the image will be re-created for each test and destroyed on
tearDown from each test.

Change-Id: Iefa6f0fec9b3eea587b1437b47cce81e1a9c242c

commit_message:
Removing non-bootable volumes from boot source

Volumes which bootable flag is set to False should
not be included in the boot source combo box when
the user select the Boot from volume option

Change-Id: I7bfe0aa1c4954ef2d50fa27db147bf15d4daccc1
Closes-Bug: #1319900

commit_message:
enable heat in grenade

this enables heat in the grenade jobs. Because we need to explicitly
tell tempest what services to test, this doesn't actually test
heat (that will depend on additional grenade changes).

This is therefore a largely no-op change in normal runs which will
make it possible for the heat team to add real grenade support.

Change-Id: I6cfb2e4abf43abf91f96e85e82fcdd1fee3f9470

commit_message:
Fix hide drop_arrow.png if only one tenant

when user only in one tenant, the tenant region show drop_arrow.png,
this will confuse user. It needs to hide.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-31 11:44:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/22e8e05413797e6cf30e11e479b72c04b6c6aacd', 'message': 'Ensure redirect happens after failure to create a keypair

In the case of an UNAUTHORIZED exception, handle() does not honor the
redirect argument. This patch ensures that the failure to create a
keypair will result in a redirect with the exception message displayed
to the user.

Change-Id: I7e52ed72d66e9d0496bc07036e48c968e7a66c2e
Closes-bug: #1299126
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-22 11:46:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/exceptions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/3a8409859fbd8c23289708980964394d2c34cb54', 'message': 'Move `Forbidden` exceptions to `RECOVERABLE` group

Previously the Forbidden exceptions raised by clients were classified
as UNAUTHORIZED. This classification is not entirely correct, as
the UNAUTHORIZED group of exceptions implies that the user should be
logged out and forced to log in again. This, however, is not the case
with Forbidden exceptions. Thus, it is more appropriate to place the
Forbidden exceptions into the RECOVERABLE group.

Change-Id: I7e52ed72d66e9d0496bc07036e48c968e7a66c2e
Closes-bug: #1299126
'}]
commit_message:
Move `Forbidden` exceptions to `RECOVERABLE` group

Previously the Forbidden exceptions raised by clients were classified
as UNAUTHORIZED. This classification is not entirely correct, as
the UNAUTHORIZED group of exceptions implies that the user should be
logged out and forced to log in again. This, however, is not the case
with Forbidden exceptions. Thus, it is more appropriate to place the
Forbidden exceptions into the RECOVERABLE group.

Change-Id: I7e52ed72d66e9d0496bc07036e48c968e7a66c2e
Closes-bug: #1299126

commit_message:
Refactor code around Console support

Add a console module to handle the different kinds on remote consoles
supported (vnc, rdp, spice ) and refactor the code
to use console.get_console.

In the future, a matrix based on HyperVisor could be added
in case that only one type of console is supported.
Ex: HyperV <=> RDP

Change-Id: If448b7c9d953765b9b56ee14b39975d951ffd92c
Implements: blueprint refactor-console-support
Closes-Bug: #1287881
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/48/78348/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: console = api.nova.server_vnc_console(request, instance_id) return shortcuts.redirect(console.url + ("&title=%s(%s)" % (instance.name, instance_id))) console = api.nova.server_spice_console(request, instance_id) return shortcuts.redirect(console.url + ("&title=%s(%s)" % (instance.name, instance_id))) console = api.nova.server_rdp_console(request, instance_id) return shortcuts.redirect(console.url + ("&title=%s(%s)" % (instance.name, instance_id)))

commit_message:
Add argparse requirement for py26

The argparse module was included in the python
standard library in python 2.7 or greater only.
This should allow bash8 to work on python 2.6 as
advertised.

Change-Id: I87f47a796de734f261b85bc72414a30d56926dcd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bashate refs/changes/30/93530/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Redstack guest agent fails if user not ubuntu

Added a chown command after useradd to change the ownership
to ${GUEST_USERNAME}
Also noted that the group being applied to GUEST_USERNAME
was incorrect - should be 'sudo'

Closes_Bug: #1317540

Change-Id: Ia670d8b8c9e7f9378a98c9fbc7885e187ef1aaa0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration refs/changes/48/92848/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: useradd -G adm -m ${GUEST_USERNAME} -s /bin/bash chown ${GUEST_USERNAME}:${GUEST_USERNAME} /home/${GUEST_USERNAME}

commit_message:
Adds roadmap for CLI Reference

Change-Id: I77d58031ec0043a69a87b6b2df84f9da2a70eefa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/87/94387/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Roadmap for CLI Reference ------------------------- This file is stored with the source to offer ideas for what to work on. Put your name next to a task if you want to work on it and put a WIP review up on review.openstack.org. May 20, 2014 To do tasks: - Add a common OpenStack Client reference chapter - Add audience information; who is this book intended for Ongoing tasks: - Ensure it meets conventions and standards - Continually add CLI commands for integrated projects; but only when the release occurs Wishlist tasks: - Add troubleshooting for clients - installation, environment variables. Can be common.

commit_message:
replaced e.message

BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6.
http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/
Replaced e.message with six.text_type(e) (uses unicode with
Python 2.x and str with Python 3.x).

Change-Id: I53aa5268ae9d262d19e3649df47e2aac1770a129
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/78/93578/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove monkey_patch from test_context

Accidentally we've forgotten to remove eventlet's monkey_patch from
test_context in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/72655

The test works just fine without the patch since context now directly
uses 'green' modules.

Change-Id: I8fc38f52c84c97731b5582afe2089be83ca1d357

commit_message:
switch to sphinxdoc

bash8 is still using sphinx.doc, which isn't available anymore
in my build environment (eg: Debian). This patch replaces the
oslo.sphinx by oslosphinx in conf.py

Change-Id: Ia2b65532d62d31aa2ff5c17e20f11a0ee5dd3f8c

subject: Return request ID to callers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-23 00:00:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient/commit/11c8a5d8f5e7ffa342d65895316ef8bd625be84b', 'message': 'Return request IDs for API calls

Currently, API calls (create, get, etc.) return only the Image to a
caller. In order to log a mapping the request IDs of both glanceclient
and the caller, the x-openstack-request-id header value is needed on
the server side. This change allows that value to be bubbled up and
returned to the caller so that the appropriate logging can occur.

Change I43be05c351f901cee5509c76cff6d69f060c0b3f is an example of
a caller using this. That change needs to be merged before this one
will be useful.

Change-Id: Ia82aa14db5f0e453010514fffb9a25d7b0fc2fd1

The send_req_id parameter can be set by services that are logging

Change I43be05c351f901cee5509c76cff6d69f060c0b3f is an example of

Currently, API calls (create, get, etc.) return only the Image to a
caller. In order to log a mapping the request IDs of both glanceclient
and the caller, the x-openstack-request-id header value is needed on
the server side. This change allows that value to be bubbled up and
returned to the caller so that the appropriate logging can occur.
The return_req_id parameter can be set by services that are logging
request IDs. Glance's request ID will then be returned via the
return_req_id parameter, or in the case of list(), as the first returned
object of paginate().

Change I43be05c351f901cee5509c76cff6d69f060c0b3f is an example of

The return_req_id parameter can be set by services that are logging

commit_message:
Return request ID to callers

Currently, calls (create, get, etc.) return only the Image to a
caller. In order to log a mapping the request IDs of both glanceclient
and the caller, the x-openstack-request-id header value is needed on
the server side. This change allows that value to be bubbled up and
returned to the caller so that the appropriate logging can occur.
The return_req_id parameter can be set by services that are logging
request IDs. Glance's request ID will then be returned via the
return_req_id parameter.

This is a prerequisite for Log Request ID Mappings nova-spec to
be completed; Change Ib9b820a0feeb0c0e828ed3e4fab8261f8761ba9a

Change I43be05c351f901cee5509c76cff6d69f060c0b3f is an example of
a caller using this.

Implements: blueprint return-req-id
Change-Id: Ia82aa14db5f0e453010514fffb9a25d7b0fc2fd1

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-23 15:00:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/c1435a33e7e47882592beccc8f8241fca0d4655e', 'message': 'replace NovaException with VirtualInterfaceCreate when neutron fails

Currently NovaException is being raised by the _neutron_failed_callback()
and being treated in a try..except block that wraps the _crate_domain method.
The exception is too generic and will catch any exceptions, which are

Suggesting to raise and catch the VirtualInterfaceCreateException and

commit_message:
replace NovaException with VirtualInterfaceCreate when neutron fails

Currently NovaException is being raised by the _neutron_failed_callback()
and being treated in a try..except block that wraps the _crate_domain method.
The exception is too generic and will catch any exceptions, which are
subclasses of NovaException (for example: ObjectActionError),
making the domain variable not be defined and will mask the original exception.

Suggesting to raise and catch the VirtualInterfaceCreateException and
treat the domain destroy and cleanup with save_and_reraise_exception
in the except block.

Change-Id: Ic972e286ded4e8b9d79ce1b0aa514bb4623d5f0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/70/89870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise exception.VirtualInterfaceCreateException() except exception.VirtualInterfaceCreateException: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): domain.destroy() self.cleanup(context, instance, network_info=network_info, block_device_info=block_device_info)
deleted_lines: raise exception.NovaException() except exception.NovaException: domain.destroy() self.cleanup(context, instance, network_info=network_info, block_device_info=block_device_info) raise exception.VirtualInterfaceCreateException()

subject: Provide way to reserve dhcp port during failovers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-07 17:27:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/56a080c572abbe7b4d4649406071657a581df6bf', 'message': "Provide way to reserve dhcp port during failovers

This change provides a way to save the dhcp port when failing
over a network from one dhcp agent to another.  When a
dhcp-agent-network-remove is issued, the dhcp port device_id is
marked as reserved which causes it to not be deleted. When a
subsequent dhcp-agent-network-add is issued, the reserved port
is used and the device_id is corrected.  This is desirable
in order to maintain the dhcp port ip address so that dns doesn't
get impacted.  This ability is configurable for those that may not
want this behavior.

Change-Id: I531d7ffab074b01adfe186d2c3df43ca978359cd
Closes-Bug: #1288923

commit_message:
Provide way to reserve dhcp port during failovers

This change provides a way to save the dhcp port when failing
over a network from one dhcp agent to another.  When a
dhcp-agent-network-remove is issued, the dhcp port device_id is
marked as reserved which causes it to not be deleted. When a
subsequent dhcp-agent-network-add is issued, the reserved port
is used and the device_id is corrected.  This is desirable
in order to maintain the dhcp port ip address so that dns doesn't
get impacted. Unit test added.

Change-Id: I531d7ffab074b01adfe186d2c3df43ca978359cd
Closes-Bug: #1288923
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/18/79018/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_dhcp_agent_device_id(network_id, host): host_uuid = uuid.uuid5(uuid.NAMESPACE_DNS, str(host)) return 'dhcp%s-%s' % (host_uuid, network_id) return get_dhcp_agent_device_id(network.id, self.conf.host) #host_uuid = uuid.uuid5(uuid.NAMESPACE_DNS, socket.gethostname()) #return 'dhcp%s-%s' % (host_uuid, network.id) # check for a reserved DHCP port if dhcp_port is None: LOG.debug(_('DHCP port %(device_id)s on network %(network_id)s' ' does not yet exist. Checking for a reserved port.'), {'device_id': device_id, 'network_id': network.id}) for port in network.ports: port_device_id = getattr(port, 'device_id', None) if port_device_id == constants.DEVICE_ID_RESERVED: dhcp_port = self.plugin.update_dhcp_port( port.id, {'port': {'device_id': device_id}}) if not dhcp_port: raise exceptions.Conflict break

drop unused relationship columns in Resource table as it accounts
for most of the deadlock cases when using multiple workers. their
existence does not improve query performance and acts as either a
bottleneck or deadlock case when recording metering data so it's
best to remove it.

commit_message:
refactor sql backend for write speed

- drop unused relationship columns in Resource table as it accounts
for most of the bottleneck/deadlock cases when using multiple workers.
their existence does not improve query performance and acts as either
a bottleneck or deadlock case when recording metering data so it's
best to remove it.

- split record_metering_data into multiple logical groupings to
to avoid wait time on commits between sessions.

Change-Id: I642e3afe17efda8f4e8b20f5740f1d5aa037be38
Implements: blueprint big-data-sql
Closes-Bug: #1305332
Closes-Bug: #1257908

Change-Id: Ib76fa39965f14931faa669a56372b274a05b67ed

commit_message:
Moves the deploy call from conductor to worker

As a side effect of updating an image to COMPLETE,
conductor was sending the signal to deployer to begin.
This patch moves that call to worker, so conductor's
only task is to update the database on behalf of other
services.

Change-Id: Ib76fa39965f14931faa669a56372b274a05b67ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/49/94249/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Complete the cachedproperty descriptor protocol

Refactor some parts of the cachedproperty property
descriptor (renaming attributes to the standard names
used in descriptor objects) and add on the __set__ and
__delete__ methods to comply with the full descriptor
protocol.

Change-Id: I1f1e8e301271c060d14acc3a77c094dabd120f16

added_lines: def __init__(self, fget): if inspect.isfunction(fget): self._fget = fget self._attr_name = "_%s" % (fget.__name__) else: self._attr_name = fget self._fget = None self._fget = fget def __set__(self, instance, value): raise AttributeError("can't set attribute") def __delete__(self, instance): raise AttributeError("can't delete attribute") def __get__(self, instance, owner): try: return getattr(instance, self._attr_name) except AttributeError: value = self._fget(instance) setattr(instance, self._attr_name, value) return value
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, wrapped): if inspect.isfunction(wrapped): self._wrapped = wrapped self._wrapped_attr = "_%s" % (wrapped.__name__) else: self._wrapped_attr = wrapped self._wrapped = None self._wrapped = fget def __get__(self, source, owner): try: return getattr(source, self._wrapped_attr) except AttributeError: setattr(source, self._wrapped_attr, self._wrapped(source)) return getattr(source, self._wrapped_attr)

commit_message:
Add MANIFEST.in to include addl files in sdist pkg

In order to successfully run now, setup.py needs to have the
README.md file and others in the sdist package. Adding the
MANIFEST.in file so that thes files get included.

Change-Id: I0c11f776c942e292b002f6424c861f8d11f66f30

Fix trove CLI help UUID references

Changed all 'UUID' references in the CLI help to 'ID' to be
consistent with list/show commands.

commit_message:
oslo.messaging context must be a dict

oslo.messaging assumes the context is a dict not a RequestContext
and it assumes the payload in json serializable.

This patch ensures this.

Also it removes oslo.messaging mock on some tests and use real oslo.messaging
library with the fake driver.

Change-Id: Ie3c6083bbc4ec83de28e42bb10e7c50c7e135070
Closes-bug: #1275771
Closes-bug: #1317290

commit_message:
Revert "Default engine workers to the number of CPUs"

This reverts commit 56041687844c7c04bfcad974a07ac3ff35f99e5c.

Problems have been reported on systems using QPID. The gate only tests
RabbitMQ.

Change-Id: Iaf83dc7582835ce5bf4534116c918640da7373aa
Partial-Bug: #1321303

Instead of setting the log level hard coded to INFO just let the used

commit_message:
Set log level to default value

Instead of setting the log level hard coded to INFO just let the used
logger module decide which level is the default. Otherwise a usage
of this module will change the log level globally to INFO which is not
the default for the python logger module (see
http://hg.python.org/cpython/file/2.7/Lib/logging/__init__.py#l1490)

Change-Id: I75a0517564e6829dfc1451c77da888548ad2219c
Closes-bug: 1320841
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslotest refs/changes/76/94176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: level = None

commit_message:
Use daemon flag only when USE_SCREEN=False

This patch removes the daemon option, when devstack is started
with USE_SCREEN=True.

Change-Id: Ib3b1c0b2abf9111b767b3d557dacdc7a89a38f59
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/14/93814/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "$USE_SCREEN" = "True" ]]; then screen_it marconi-server "marconi-server --config-file $MARCONI_CONF --daemon" else screen_it marconi-server "marconi-server --config-file $MARCONI_CONF" fi

subject: Mask passwords that are included in commands
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-18 18:35:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/04ffa89fca7a3a066012c8508256f3cf3f13a455', 'message': "Mask passwords that are included in commands

The current password masking doesn't scrub passwords from commands
that may be written to log files.  This commit adds support for
scrubbing passwords provided as options with commands, where the
tokens in the command are separated by commas and wrapped in quotes.

Adds tests to ensure commands are properly sanitized.

commit_message:
Mask passwords that are included in commands

The current password masking doesn't scrub passwords from commands
that may be written to log files.  This commit adds support for
scrubbing passwords provided as options with commands.

Adds tests to ensure commands are properly sanitized.

Change-Id: I37b9a80142ec5dcadb731332d8c5f494bdc7bfc1
Closes-Bug: #1320028

commit_message:
Use safe way through "with" statement to work with files

It's good practice to use with statement to work with files. This way files get
closed automatically at the end of the block. Fixed some cases, including some
where file wasn't closed after usage

Change-Id: I9399f2a2b7edb1cd5aa64782cd9f980f9233b827

commit_message:
Check whether O_DIRECT is supported to iflag and oflag separately

The problem is when this is used for volume clear and the clear method
specifies use of the 'zero' option (/dev/zero) setting iflag direct is
not a valid option for that input file, but oflag direct is a valid
option for output file, so we should check iflag and oflag separately.

Change-Id: I4b627e95b68d56e3011cddc577c62fad0c384dba
Close-Bug: 1318748

commit_message:
orchestration: add test for untyped provider resources

It's also possible to specify the filename directly in the template
without adding the type alias to resource_registry, then heat looks
up the provider/nested-stack resource in the "files" map passed when
creating the stack.

Change-Id: Idce23021dd4ddcedef61ffdd39d6abb16885e1be
Partial-Bug: #1317095
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/12/92612/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='gate') def test_files_provider_resource(self): """Test untyped defining of a provider resource via "files".""" # It's also possible to specify the filename directly in the template. # without adding the type alias to resource_registry stack_name = data_utils.rand_name('heat') template = ''' heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 resources: random: type: my_random.yaml outputs: random_value: value: {get_attr: [random, random_value]} ''' files = {'my_random.yaml': self.load_template('random_string')} stack_identifier = self.create_stack(stack_name, template, files=files) self.client.wait_for_stack_status(stack_identifier, 'CREATE_COMPLETE') # random_string.yaml specifies a length of 10 random_value = self.get_stack_output(stack_identifier, 'random_value') self.assertEqual(10, len(random_value))

commit_message:
orchestration: Add test for resource_registry environment

Adds support for passing files argument to the create/update
calls in the json client, and adds a simple test of defining
a provider resource, which is a user-defined resource type,
mapped via the "resource_registry" section of the environment
file, with the filename looked up by a key in the files map.

Change-Id: I87fd1f2b1cf2c68c22d53891d99c8cd6b6b7c777
Partial-Bug: #1317095
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/09/92609/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='gate') def test_environment_provider_resource(self): """Test passing resource_registry defining a provider resource.""" stack_name = data_utils.rand_name('heat') template = ''' heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 resources: random: type: My:Random::String outputs: random_value: value: {get_attr: [random, random_value]} ''' environment = {'resource_registry': {'My:Random::String': 'my_random.yaml'}} files = {'my_random.yaml': self.load_template('random_string')} stack_identifier = self.create_stack(stack_name, template, environment=environment, files=files) self.client.wait_for_stack_status(stack_identifier, 'CREATE_COMPLETE') # random_string.yaml specifies a length of 10 random_value = self.get_stack_output(stack_identifier, 'random_value') self.assertEqual(10, len(random_value))

logging messages. Using logging function parameters should
be preferred.

Partial-Bug: #1321274

subject: Do not validate constraints in schema constructor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-30 22:44:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/86712e7be3fa2b753edb1d09e96199017dde637b', 'message': 'Do not validate constraints in schema constructor

This patch moves validation of constraints out of the constructor of
schema objects into a separate method that can be invoked on the
schema objects after creation. This gives us more control over when
validation shall be invoked.

This patch fixes an issue with custom constraints that could not be
validated when having a default value, since they require the RPC
context to be present. However, the context was not present in the
places where needed.
The short-sighted fix would have been to change a lot of method
signatures to pass the context properly, but that did not seem to be
really clean. The better fix seemed to be to move validation into
a separate method that can be invoked with the proper context. This
will also give us more control on when we do validation, and which
validation we do.

This patch
Closes-Bug: #1314240

This patch will also enable to fix
Related-Bug: #1314401
Partial-Bug: #1314401

For that bug it will be necessary to switch of validation under
certain conditions, which was not possible before when doing
validation right in the constructor.

Change-Id: I19e1fb520551eb42bf36bb380f1cc28c81bbaedd
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-01 21:40:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/1eb1b7dd9f679a9c4a833f9d3e153e84e4291d60', 'message': 'Do not validate constraints in schema constructor

This patch moves validation of constraints out of the constructor of
schema objects into a separate method that can be invoked on the
schema objects after creation. This gives us more control over when
validation shall be invoked.

This patch fixes an issue with custom constraints that could not be
validated when having a default value, since they require the RPC
context to be present. However, the context was not present in the
places where needed.
The short-sighted fix would have been to change a lot of method
signatures to pass the context properly, but that did not seem to be
really clean. The better fix seemed to be to move validation into
a separate method that can be invoked with the proper context. This
will also give us more control on when we do validation, and which
validation we do.

This patch
Closes-Bug: #1314240

This patch will also enable to fix
Related-Bug: #1314401
Partial-Bug: #1314401

For that bug it will be necessary to switch of validation under
certain conditions, which was not possible before when doing

commit_message:
Do not validate constraints in schema constructor

This patch moves validation of constraints out of the constructor of
schema objects into a separate method that can be invoked on the
schema objects after creation. This gives us more control over when
validation shall be invoked.

This patch fixes an issue with custom constraints that could not be
validated when having a default value, since they require the RPC
context to be present. However, the context was not present in the
places where needed.
The short-sighted fix would have been to change a lot of method
signatures to pass the context properly, but that did not seem to be
really clean. The better fix seemed to be to move validation into
a separate method that can be invoked with the proper context. This
will also give us more control on when we do validation, and which
validation we do.

This patch
Closes-Bug: #1314240

This patch will also enable to fix
Partial-Bug: #1314401

For that bug it will be necessary to switch off validation under
certain conditions, which was not possible before when doing
validation right in the constructor.

Change-Id: I19e1fb520551eb42bf36bb380f1cc28c81bbaedd

commit_message:
Fixes an erroneous type check in a test

The latest version of requests changes the type of a Response's history.
See https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/commit/b8128d6

Closes-Bug: #1321042
Change-Id: Iba9fa20d22d878a4298a35e270338ee442031796

commit_message:
Added support of resize-flavor to Redis datastore

trove resize-flavor was not supported for Redis;
If this command is indeed invoked, then the DB VM
would be stuck at the RESIZE state forever, as the
revert function (reset_configuration) is not implemented too;

This patch implements the resizing functionality for Redis

Change-Id: I93a1fe6e583636d72b8d399418d80bd124b36285
Closes-Bug: #1300477

added_lines: self.status.end_install_or_restart() def start_db_with_conf_changes(self, config_contents): LOG.info(_("Starting redis with conf changes...")) LOG.info(_("inside the guest - self.status.is_redis_running(%s)...") % self.status.is_running) if self.status.is_running: LOG.error(_("Cannot execute start_db_with_conf_changes because " "Redis state == %s!") % self.status) raise RuntimeError("Redis not stopped.") LOG.info(_("Initiating config.")) self.write_config(config_contents) self.start_redis(True) def reset_configuration(self, configuration): config_contents = configuration['config_contents'] LOG.info(_("Resetting configuration")) self.write_config(config_contents)

commit_message:
Fix prepare call for redis guest agent

Changes:
- The mount point ownership now changed to redis user and group
- Redis restarted to use new config elements

Change-Id: I972cd0c7f6baaed8d8c2a61d096f39a283685237
Closes-Bug: #1298536

Add range constraint to AWS volume size

Such constraint was added to OS::Cinder::Volume but was missing
from its AWS counterpart.

Related-Bug: #1267747

commit_message:
NSX: fix error when creating VM ports on subnets without dhcp

The error was caused by a missing LSN port (which is created when
the subnet is setup with dhcp enabled). Therefore, check the port
is in place before proceeding with the setup.

Change-Id: I658ead0c324a24ad3f061844ecac13cd3359d341
Closes-bug: 1316365
(cherry picked from commit 7458427a0018437f4c7cac127bcd03c93cccfe70)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/70/94270/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: lsn_id, lsn_port_id = self.lsn_port_get( context, network_id, subnet_id, raise_on_err=False) try: if lsn_id and lsn_port_id: hdlr(self.cluster, lsn_id, lsn_port_id, data)
deleted_lines: lsn_id = None lsn_port_id = None try: lsn_id, lsn_port_id = self.lsn_port_get( context, network_id, subnet_id) hdlr(self.cluster, lsn_id, lsn_port_id, data)

commit_message:
fixed several pep8 issues

  * E113 unexpected indentation
  * E121 continuation line under-indented for hanging indent
  * E122 continuation line missing indentation or outdented
  * E251 unexpected spaces around keyword / parameter equals
  * E265 block comment should start with '# '
  * E713 test for membership should be 'not in'
  * E714 test for object identity should be 'is not'

Also changed used pep8 version in test-requirements to
8==1.4.6,==1.5.6.

Change-Id: If39da01db5dfae81e7702902b5fe1d5a0224bb19

commit_message:
NSX: do not raise on missing router during migration step

Return None for missing router rather raising NotFound exception;
this is what the client code was expected to handle in the first
place.

Closes-bug: 1313918

Change-Id: I573770a69d0170b027fc990c29aaa87b1fc8eccc
(cherry picked from commit 5e843850527ede7a56fcc24753f87c1e9e3e8bed)

commit_message:
Importing "test.py" module instead of "attr" func

There are many files in Tempest where function "attr" is imported
instead of "test.py" module itself. This patch set fixes that.

Change-Id: Iceb6fa625a27ec10bdb8883b112b9d2bf19e151d

commit_message:
Reduced database overhead from agents

 - added dedicated handler for node agents update only requests
 - caching data from agents to avoid db update with same data
 - nailgun responses with appropriate http statuses
 - changed agent update logic. Now it tries to update first and respects
   nailgun response statuses

Implements: blueprint nailgun-agent-handler
Closes-Bug: #1274614

Conflicts:
	nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_node_nic_handler.py

Change-Id: I2658cf7561cd8c9116acced2443d072d471f3bdb
